conclusion: Understanding the problem involves an ideal gas and a graph with points A, B, and C.

Volume is constant from A to B, so volume stays at V₀ while temperature increases.
Point C is where the extension of BC passes through the origin O.
Point A is at (T₀, V₀), Point B at (?, 2V₀), Point C at (?, ?).

AB is vertical from A (T₀, V₀) to B (T₀, 2V₀), indicating constant volume.
Extension of BC passes through origin O, suggesting OC is a straight line.
Summarizing: A is (T₀, V₀), B is (T₁, 2V₀), C is (T₂, V₂), extension of BC passes through O.
AB is parallel to the V axis, meaning constant volume, but B is at 2V₀, suggesting a contradiction.
